text: As you can see, some of the anomalies from the previous day would be, again, potentially any kind of high volume or low volume highs and lows, potential ledges, bad highs, and then the location of the volume point of control. As we can see, the market initially opened and drove up higher towards the previous day's high and in terms of the current day's profile, we don't have too many anomalies other than the very aggressive low volume areas. What we would then typically do is we would then typically look for any kind of anomalies in the previous couple of sessions that the market might want to complete. As you can see in the larger of the two charts, we have an untraded or a naked VPOC. This is just a VPOC that hasn't been traded over a period of time. Again, we can also see some high volume nodes there that weren't retested, as well as a whole host of other potential anomalies in the previous days. What we would then look to do is we would then look to go and formulate a daily hypothesis Now, based on the current day's profile, we would look with all the objective information provided in points one to seven, we could look to establish some sort of a trade setup whereby if the market opens and holds, in other words the cash market opens and holds above the previous day's value area high, we'd look for an early retest of the previous This would be a very bullish hypothesis number one, if however the market failed to hold that break above the previous day's value and came back inside the value as we can see it did, we would then turn far more neutral on the day type. We would also then look if the market then took out the previous day's value area low and continued to hold below their previous day's value area low. There's a high likelihood we have some positioning in the market from the long side as well as a substantial low volume area that requires filling out. This would be our bearish hypothesis on the day. This is now how you would basically complete, you know, this would be a basic trading profile routine that traders would do every single morning both ahead of the market open and ahead of the cash open. Now don't forget, it's important that you go and establish your own routine. Try and identify the key factors that will add value to your trading before the session begins. Good luck.
